messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Nobunaga = Hitler #2
messages.msgSnippet: ... Whatever you are, you seem not to have problems in telling what is right from what is wrong. Where is that security coming from? It doesn t matter if
messages.messageBody:
On Jun 6, 2004, at 7:08 PM, medhal8@...;-ljon Oddhinsson wrote:

> WhoÂ´s "modern-enlightenment-christian influenced standard"?
> My Individual Liberties line of though is not christian in any way.
> And I think the guy of Sweden guessed what I am. Just would say that I
> am
> not even an monotheist.

Whatever you are, you seem not to have problems in telling what is
right from what is wrong.
Where is that security coming from? It doesn't matter if you're a
Muslim fundamentalist, or a Hindu who believes in 300.000.000 of Gods,
when you judge so straightforwardly you show that you are pointing back
to some truth you recognize as ultimate.
That might be right according to YOUR point of view, but let me tell
you that it is a very surpassed approach when it comes to history.
At least, admit that your opinion is subjective.
The discussion is interesting if anybody proposed something, not if the
participants try to impose their own ideas.

cepo
